metadata.title: Epidemiological analysis on a family cluster of COVID-19
affiliations: General Office of National Health Commission. Prevention and control protocol for Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia（version 3）[EB/OL].（2020-01-28）[2020-02-24].http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/zhengcwj/202001/470b128513fe46f086d79667db9f76a5.shtml.

metadata.abstract: Epidemiological investigation was conducted for a family cluster of COVID-19 (8 cases) with descriptive epidemiological method, and respiratory tract samples of the cases were collected for the nucleic acid detection of 2019-nCoV by RT-PCR.

methods: Epidemiological investigation was conducted for a family cluster of COVID-19 (8 cases) with descriptive epidemiological method, and respiratory tract samples of the cases were collected for the nucleic acid detection of 2019-nCoV by RT-PCR.
results: Two primary cases, which occurred on 31 January and 1 February, 2020, respectively, had a common exposure history in Wuhan. The other six family members had onsets on 30 January, 31 January, 1 February (three cases) and 3 February, 2020.
conclusions: In this family cluster of COVID-19, six family members were infected through common family exposure to the 2 primary cases. Five secondary cases had onsets earlier than or on the same day as the primary cases, indicating that COVID-19 is contagious in incubation period, and the home isolation in the early phase of the epidemic might lead to the risk of family cluster of COVID-19.

Methods: Epidemiological investigation was conducted for a family cluster of COVID-19 (8 cases) with descriptive epidemiological method, and respiratory tract samples of the cases were collected for the nucleic acid detection of 2019-nCoV by RT-PCR.
Results: Two primary cases, which occurred on 31 January and 1 February, 2020, respectively, had a common exposure history in Wuhan. The other six family members had onsets on 30 January, 31 January, 1 February (three cases) and 3 February, 2020.
Conclusions: In this family cluster of COVID-19, six family members were infected through common family exposure to the 2 primary cases. Five secondary cases had onsets earlier than or on the same day as the primary cases, indicating that COVID-19 is contagious in incubation period, and the home isolation in the early phase of the epidemic might lead to the risk of family cluster of COVID-19.

summary: General Office of National Health Commission, General Office of National Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine.
Diagnostic and treatment protocol for Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia (Trial version 4)[EB/OL].
Special Expert Group for Control of the Epidemic of Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia of the Chinese Preventive Medicine Association.
An update on the epidemiological characteristics of novel coronavirus pneumonia (COVID-19)[J].
General Office of National Health Commission.
Prevention and control protocol for Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia（version 4）[EB/OL].

To understand the possible transmission route of a family cluster of COVID-19 in Zhengzhou and the potential infectivity of COVID-19 in incubation period, and provide scientific evidence for the timely control of infectious source and curb the spread of the epidemic.

Epidemiological investigation was conducted for a family cluster of COVID-19 (8 cases) with descriptive epidemiological method, and respiratory tract samples of the cases were collected for the nucleic acid detection of 2019-nCoV by RT-PCR.
Two primary cases, which occurred on 31 January and 1 February, 2020, respectively, had a common exposure history in Wuhan.
The other six family members had onsets on 30 January, 31 January, 1 February and 3 February, 2020.
In this family cluster of COVID-19, six family members were infected through common family exposure to the 2 primary cases.

Five secondary cases had onsets earlier than or on the same day as the primary cases, indicating that COVID-19 is contagious in incubation period, and the home isolation in the early phase of the epidemic might lead to the risk of family cluster of COVID-19.

Introduction: General Office of National Health Commission, General Office of National Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine.
Diagnostic and treatment protocol for Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia (Trial version 4)[EB/OL].
Results: Special Expert Group for Control of the Epidemic of Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia of the Chinese Preventive Medicine Association.

General Office of National Health Commission.
Prevention and control protocol for Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia（version 4）[EB/OL].

To understand the possible transmission route of a family cluster of COVID-19 in Zhengzhou and the potential infectivity of COVID-19 in incubation period, and provide scientific evidence for the timely control of infectious source and curb the spread of the epidemic.

Epidemiological investigation was conducted for a family cluster of COVID-19 (8 cases) with descriptive epidemiological method, and respiratory tract samples of the cases were collected for the nucleic acid detection of 2019-nCoV by RT-PCR.
Two primary cases, which occurred on 31 January and 1 February, 2020, respectively, had a common exposure history in Wuhan.
Conclusion: The other six family members had onsets on 30 January, 31 January, 1 February and 3 February, 2020.
In this family cluster of COVID-19, six family members were infected through common family exposure to the 2 primary cases.

Five secondary cases had onsets earlier than or on the same day as the primary cases, indicating that COVID-19 is contagious in incubation period, and the home isolation in the early phase of the epidemic might lead to the risk of family cluster of COVID-19.
